answers.text:
Hi Charlotte, 
There are many great examples of the Knowledge Network of public-private sponsorship agreements that should provide some insight into how to value your parks and facilities.
•   This document is an example of a general policy agreement and within the document it touches on how the rates of sponsorship are determined and should provide a good jumping off point for determining the value of your parks and facilities. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/14225
•   This white paper “Parks and Recreation Departments Partner with Local Organizations and Everyone Wins” may also be a good resource for you as it details four partnerships similar to what it sounds like your local government is looking to achieve.  http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302938/Parks_and_Recreation_Departments_Partner_with_Local_Organizations_and_Everyone_Wins
I hope this helps you in determining the value of your parks and facilities. 
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

author: Charlotte Presensky
text: Our City is considering a comprehensive sponsorship program. We are looking for examples of how an agency might have determined the sponsorship value of their facilities and parks?  Any information would be helpful.
title: Valuing Park Facilities for Sponsorship Potential
